title: How to Bake Crab Legs

methods.name: Baking Crab Legs with Garlic Butter Sauce

steps.headline: Thaw the crab legs.
steps.description: If you bought frozen crab legs, let them defrost in the refrigerator for 8 to 12 hours. You can also place the crab legs under cold running water until they're defrosted.

steps.headline: Cut the crab legs and preheat the oven.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 350 °F (177 °C). Rinse the crab legs with cold water and use towels to pat them dry. Take a pair of kitchen shears and cut each crab leg lengthwise. Cutting a long slit in the shell of the legs will help the meat absorb the flavorful sauce.

steps.headline: Melt the butter and add the seasonings.
steps.description: Measure 3/4 cup (170 g) of salted butter into a small saucepan. Turn the heat to medium and melt the butter. Whisk in 3 tablespoons (15 g) of finely minced garlic, 1/4 cup (60 ml) of dry white wine, 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of lemon juice, and 1/4 cup (5 g) of finely chopped flat leaf Italian parsley. If you want a smoky flavor, add 1 teaspoon (2 g) of hot smoked paprika.

steps.headline: Whisk and simmer the sauce for 1 minute.
steps.description: Keep the heat on medium and whisk the sauce until the ingredients combine and become fragrant. This should take 1 minute. Turn off the heat.

steps.headline: Place the crab legs on a sheet and coat them with the sauce.
steps.description: Lay the crab legs on a rimmed baking sheet. Pour three-quarters of the butter sauce over the legs. The legs should be covered with the sauce. Set the remaining butter sauce aside to use for basting the legs as they cook.

steps.headline: Bake the crabs for 8 minutes and baste them with the sauce.
steps.description: Put the sheet of crab legs in the preheated oven and cook them for 8 minutes. Open the oven door and dip a pastry brush in the butter sauce. Brush the sauce over the legs and close the oven door.

steps.headline: Cook the crab legs for 8 more minutes and baste them.
steps.description: Open the oven door after cooking them for another 8 minutes and brush more of the butter sauce over the legs. Close the oven door.

steps.headline: Bake the crab legs for 6 minutes.
steps.description: Remove the crab legs from the oven once they've finished cooking. King crab legs will take a total of 22 minutes. If you're using snow crab clusters, you'll need to reduce cooking time by 7 minutes or by 4 minutes, if you're using dungeness crab clusters.

steps.headline: Serve the crab legs with the butter sauce.
steps.description: Set the hot crab out on a large serving platter. Pour the buttery liquid from the baking sheet into dipping bowls. Place these near the crab legs for guests to dip the meat into. Remember to set out crab cracking tools and paper towels. Store leftover crab legs in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days in an airtight container.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and heat oil in a skillet.
steps.description: Turn the oven on to 400 °F (204 °C). Set an ovenproof skillet that's at least 3 inches (7.5 cm) deep on the stove. Pour 1/4 cup (60 ml) of extra-virgin olive oil into the skillet and turn the heat to medium.

steps.headline: Chop and sauté onion with garlic for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Peel 1 medium onion and use a sharp knife to finely chop it. You'll also need to peel 6 large cloves of garlic and press them with a garlic press or the flat blade of a knife. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet. Stir and sauté the aromatics until they soften a little. This should take 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir in and boil the wine for 2 minutes.
steps.description: Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of dry white wine into the skillet and turn the heat to high. Stir and boil the wine in the onion mixture for 2 minutes. Consider using chardonnay, sauvignon blanc, or a muscadet.

steps.headline: Add the rest of the cioppino ingredients.
steps.description:
Pour 2 cups (473 ml) of bottled clam juice into the skillet and add 2 15-ounce (425 g) cans of chopped tomatoes with their juice. You'll also need to add:
1 cup (240 ml) water
2 bay leaves
1/2 cup (15 g) fresh Italian parsley leaves
1/2 teaspoon (1 g) dried crushed red pepper
Coarse kosher salt and pepper to taste

steps.headline: Simmer the cioppino for 15 minutes and add the crab legs.
steps.description: Turn the heat on the skillet down to medium-low. Let the cioppino bubble gently for 15 minutes and then arrange 2 pounds (907 g) of crab legs in the skillet.

steps.headline: Roast the cioppino crab legs for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: Wear an oven mitt and transfer the hot skillet to the preheated oven. Bake the cioppino crab legs until the legs are completely warmed up. This should take 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve the cioppino crab legs.
steps.description: Remove the hot skillet from the oven and transfer the hot crab legs to a large serving bowl. Pour the cioppino into the same bowl and set out smaller bowls for guests to serve themselves. You should also set out crab cracking tools and plenty of napkins or paper towels. Store leftover crab legs in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days in an airtight container.
